sentences: Matthew Dear (born April 4, 1979) is an American music producer, DJ and electronic avant-pop artist.
Dear's first single was 1999's "Hands Up For Detroit" (co-produced by ghettotech pioneer Disco D, who performed under the name Daisha).
The album's single "Dog Days" became one of Spectral's best sellers and a favorite of international DJs like Richie Hawtin.
Dear followed the album with Backstroke in 2004 and has also begun working under the harder-edged Audion alias, apart from additional monikers False and Jabberjaw.
Matthew and his band, Matthew Dear's Big Hands, then began a US promotional tour and a European tour as the opening act for Hot Chip.
2004 DJ Minx A Walk In The Park (M_nus)
2008 Kieran Hebden, Steve Reid "People Be Happy/Rhythm Dance" (Domino)
2010 Charlotte Gainsbourg "Time Of The Assassins" (Because Music)
2006 Just a Man / Just a Woman [with Ellen Allien] (Audion VI, Spectral Sound)
